But there are influences between characters - water tames fire and so on, so when you play fire, fire character moves one space forward, but another two characters move too - one forward and one backward. These influences are nicely shown on the board.
When first of kiumbis reaches the centre the game ends and who has supported this character wins. Game can also end sooner, when somebody guesses another players secret favorit.

Name: Roary: Silver Path
Description:
It's a children racing game. 
Players throw with 2 dices, one normal with numbers from 1 to 6, but the other one is for the careful ones and it contains only numbers 1 and 2, three of each. Player can throw with both dices or only one of his/her choice.
Players move around the board and in every turn they have to stop once, otherwise their car got out of control and they have to wait for one turn.
When two players end up in one spot, they battle for the leading place with dice.

Name: Contractor
Description:
Contractor is designed for up to six players who bid for jobs, buy equipment and compete for supremacy. Like real life, the winner avoids bad situations, capitalizes on opportunity and eventually makes the most money.

A contractor's duties go beyond digging holes, moving dirt and putting up walls. The success of contractors is decided by many factors: union and employee relations, land and property costs and equipment purchases and breakdowns. Encounter the daily woes of a contractor as you struggle to keep ahead of bad weather, employee situations, and most of all, your competitors.

Players move tokens around the board and work on their jobs when they land on a Workday space. Each job is divided into ten phases. Each time you complete a phase, the bank pays you one-tenth of your bid price. You earn rent money in two ways: when the equipment you own is required on other player's jobs, and when other players land on your equipment space. The player with the most money wins.

Description taken from the game box and instruction booklet.

Name: Pocahontas Electronic Talking Board Game
Description:
From the description on the box:

"Actual voices and sound effects from the movie direct game play and guide Pocahontas through the Enchanted Glade towards Captain John Smith. Try to be the first to bring the two together, with help from your animal friends... but watch out for ruthless Governor Ratcliffe!"

This game features a keyboard device that the children press to generate the voices and sound effects. There is also a colorful 3-D playing surface plus some character stands representing the Indian maiden and the explorer. Movement is determined by a spinner. Designed for kids ages 3 to 6 years old with no reading required to play the game.

Name: Monster Matsch
Description:
The players form monsters from play-do (using templates) und uses these to race along a track. They roll and move the number rolled, adding 2 when ending on a field with a shamrock symbol. When they roll a hammer, though, another player can use the hammer and smash the monster which then has to be rebuilt and start at the beginning again. The first monster to reach the finish line is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

Name: Bar Trek...the pub crawl game!!
Description: Players go from pub to pub collecting beer mats and drink tokens, with the occasional visit to a betting shop when short of cash. The game ends when one player has collected six different beer mats. The player with the most drink vouchers at the end is the winner.  Source:Game Rules

Name: Spaceport Criminal Escape
Description:
Spaceport Criminal Escape is a cooperative game, set on a planetary space station far into the future. 
During the game players become one of earth’s most wanted criminals (a thief, forger, hacker, smuggler and assassin) who are attempting to flee earth to avoid trial. In order to escape they must purchase a ticket to board an outbound ship. At the same time they must avoid being recognised and arrested by the station’s patrols.

During the game the players move around the station attempting to collect enough money in order to purchase a ticket to escape, with each character having its own way to do so e.g. The thief steals wallets while at luggage stations while the hacker steals money from currency terminals (ATMs). Once a player has enough money to escape they purchase a ticket from the ticket office and move to the embarkation area where they become “Safe”.

Name: Mijn Eerste Van Dale Liedjesbingo
Description:
A bingo game with a CD for a bingo-caller.  While you listen to the songs on the CD or read the card, you look quickly for the referred word on your bingo card. If so, then you place a chip on the word. 
The first player who filled his card with 9 chips, call 'Bingo!' and wins the game.

Contents:
- CD with 28 songs
- 6 cards
- chips
- 4 bingo sheets

Name: Schatzinsel
Description: Schatzinsel is an easy dice-driven race game for kids. You run around an island on a stated path, the number of steps is indicated by a 6-sided dice. If you reach a field with treasure, you can pick it up. If all are picked, the players have to return to the ship. The player with the most treasure wins, if there is a tie, the moment you reached the ship is the tiebreaker.

Name: Hocus Pocus
Description:
Players are young wizards who fight over magic gems.

At his/her turn, one plays Hocus cards, while every player can play Pocus cards.

• The 50 red Hocus cards are powerful 9 different spells allowing players to draw cards, take or steal gems, force an opponent to discard cards, look at the cards on the top of the pile…

• The 25 yellow Pocus cards can only be combined with a Hocus card already in play, modifying its effects in order to protect oneself against a evil spell, double the effect of any spell, remove all other Pocus cards in play… There're 8 different Pocus cards.

Every wizard has always 3 of his/her cards face up in front of him/her, so every player partially knows the hand of all the others.

At the end of his/her turn, a player can either draw 2 cards or take 1 gem from the magic cauldron. The game ends whenever the cauldron is empty, and the player with the most gems wins.

Name: Gear Krieg Fields of War
Description:
Publisher Blurb:

This tactical sourcebook explores the various theaters of the early days of the Alternate Second World War and the operations that took place in them. Fields of War contains numerous tactical scenario seeds for the Gear Krieg universe that can be played together or separately, along with sample strike forces and heroes, special rules and miniature modeling advice for both the tabletop and the Gear Krieg miniatures.

Fields of War includes:

- Rules for Natural, Urban and Combat Engineering tabletop features; 
- Scenario seeds for the above environments; 
- Modeling instructions for both the tabletop and miniatures; 
- New Heroes and equipment for Germany, the British Commonwealth, the United States, Soviet Russia and Imperial Japan; 
- and several new vehicles and variants.

A copy of the Gear Krieg Rulebook, a few six-sided dice, miniatures/counters, pen and paper are required to use this supplement.

Name: Tide of Iron: Fury of the Bear
Description:
From publisher's website:

Despite Soviet defenses, Germany continued to gain momentum from successes in other areas. Operation Typhoon began, targeting Moscow. But once again, Soviet defense forces pushed Germany back. A counter-attack would soon follow...

Fantasy Flight Games is pleased to announce Fury of the Bear, an upcoming expansion to Tide of Iron! Take command of the Germans or the Soviet forces as war on the Eastern Front begins.

The Fury of the Bear expansion for Tide of Iron builds on an already epic game experience by adding the forces of an entirely new nation, as well as new vehicles, winter terrain, scenarios, and more! Featuring nearly 100 plastic figures for the Soviet army, plus new German figures, tokens, cards, and 9 new Eastern Front map boards, the Fury of the Bear expansion will let you experience Tide of Iron in an entirely new way.

In addition, Fury of the Bear will also offer exciting new mechanics, such as a combined strategy deck, a system of counter intelligence known as subversion, and all-new specialization types! Keep checking back! In the coming weeks we will explore these aspects of Fury of the Bear with a series of previews leading up to its release.

With all these additions, not to mention the most tanks of any Tide of Iron release, Fury of the Bear will expand your options and challenge your strategies!

This summer, the invasion begins. Are you prepared to face the fury of a nation?

Name: Table Talk
Description:
Welcome to "Table Talk". The Greeks had a word for it, Deipnosophy, from the words Deipnon - dinner, and Sophist - wise man, which when combined mean Skilled in Dining and Table Talk!

Stimulating and fun to play, this gourmet After-Dinner Game combines Luck, Skill & Team Strategy to win.

-(from the box cover)

"Table Talk" is a food-related trivia game. Each team receives a "Menu" of 600 questions and answers, and appoints a "Chef" (team captain) to ask the questions of the opposing team, operate the timer, record the score, etc. Each chef, in turn, will ask successive players on the opposing team a question: if the team confers (answering "Table d'hôte") and answer correctly, they score a point; however, if the player asked chooses to answer without conferring with his teammates ("À la carte"), a correct answer scores 2 points.

Each page of the Menu provides questions in the following categories, in order: Starters; Main Course; Side Dishes; Desserts, Savouries & Cheese Board; Wine List; and Culinary Trivia - "Table Talk". Questions must be asked in the order they appear in the Menu: players do not have a choice of the category of the question. Note: A number of culinary anecdotes ("Jokers") have been randomly inserted in place of a question; a player who receives a Joker scores a point without having to answer a question.

The game is recommended for 4-12 players, split into two teams.

Game components:

     2 Menus, each containing 600 questions (1200 total) and the rules
     2 coloured page clips - one for each Menu - to mark the current question
     2 score indicators
     2 score indicator stands
     Egg timer


-(user summary)

Name: DéfiZen
Description:
The game consists of 20 pieces, all of which are differently shaped. There are several suggestions for solitaire puzzles, but also a multiplayer game idea:

An architect and a master builder are chosen from among the players. The other players are builders. The master builder choses a piece as the base, the architect adds another piece on top of it (the pieces are interlocking). Then all players take turns adding another piece. The "building" has to remain stable and it is not allowed to block the next player. The players may hold the building while adding their piece; when they think it is stable they let go. If it collapses, the player who caused that is penalized, so is the architect. If all pieces are used up, all players get points with the architect getting a bonus. Several rounds are played and points are noted. When the players decide to end the game, the player with most points is the winner.

There are several versions of this game, using different materials: wood, aluminum etc.

Name: Braille Scrabble
Description: While nothing more than regular scrabble, it comes with a large board that has plastic overlay that will hold the tiles, and has a braille board.  Tiles are Bakelite and have both English lettering along with the corresponding Braille lettering.  Finally, includes both instructions in English and Braille.
